messages.title: Election Communication
messages.content: What we really stand for. Forgive me for being so familiar and using your christian name but what I have to say is important for the future of our country that I wanted you to read it personally... I hope you can vote for me on 7th May.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: UKIP wants to leave the European Union, believing that membership does not benefit the UK. Advocates for spending the foreign aid budget on 'things that really matter' domestically.
Proposes cutting back on foreign aid budget to use the £30 billion in ways that will benefit the UK domestically.
UKIP intends to control borders to regulate immigration, emphasizing that this is not about excluding Commonwealth citizens.

issues.brexitEurope: UKIP aims to leave the European Union and control immigration.
issues.immigration: Wants to control immigration but clarifies that it doesn't mean excluding Commonwealth citizens.

images.caption: Election leaflet for Tom Rubython, UKIP Northampton North candidate.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet explains certain misunderstandings regarding UKIP's stance on immigration and the EU. It highlights the party's desire to leave the EU and control Britain's borders while still welcoming individuals from allied countries. There is also a focus on reallocating the foreign aid budget to domestic needs.
